Key Match Events: Luke Weaver was one out away from securing a three-games-to-none lead for the Yankees in the ALCS.
Lane Thomas doubled off the left-field wall, followed by Jhonkensy Noel's home run, which lost the Yankees' lead.
David Fry hit a two-run blast off Clay Holmes in the 10th inning, leading to a 7-5 victory for the Guardians.
Aaron Judge hit a homer off Emmanuel Clase to tie the score in the eighth inning.
Giancarlo Stanton hit a go-ahead shot following Judge's homer.
Post-Match Reflections: Luke Weaver expressed feeling like he let the team down after failing to secure the win.
Aaron Judge described the game as 'two good teams going after it' with 'great at-bat after great at-bat.'
Yankees manager Aaron Boone called the game a classic and praised both teams for their performances.
Anthony Rizzo reflected on a similar experience during the 2016 World Series and expressed confidence in bouncing back.
Giancarlo Stanton emphasized that a loss is a loss, regardless of the margin, and stressed the importance of moving forward.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians used eight pitchers for mostly stellar work.
Second baseman Andrés Giménez and first baseman Josh Naylor made a pivotal double-gasp highlight in the 10th inning.
The Guardians stole three bases, and all four bench players (Fry, Noel, Will Brennan, and Bo Naylor) got hits.
